key_facts: The 9/11 terrorist attacks were the direct catalyst for the formation of My Chemical Romance, as witness Gerard Way was inspired to leave his career in comics and pursue music.
The band's four core members are brothers Gerard and Mikey Way, guitarist Ray Toro, and guitarist Frank Iero, all originating from New Jersey.
Frank Iero's previous band, Pency Prep, was stylistically a precursor to MCR and its disbandment and his connections to Eyeball Records were crucial for MCR's formation and initial success.
The band's early lineup was formed when Gerard Way recruited drummer Matt Pelissier and guitarist Ray Toro, followed by Mikey Way on bass.
My Chemical Romance signed with Eyeball Records and recorded their debut album, 'I Brought You My Bullets, You Brought Me Your Love,' in early 2002.
